Reviews.Title: “A good base in central New York”
Reviews.Author: sjmUkBased
Reviews.Content: We booked on line, getting a good price for a week in New York. Hotel is small, right by Grand Central Station, so very central. Reception helpful and friendly. Room was a good size, with adequate shower room. Rather feeble shower. Very comfortable bed, and room not at all noisy. Quite classy tea/coffee making in room, and fridge large enough to hold "proper" milk (which we always buy). Didn't use attached restaurant, there is a 6 am - 4pm deli almost next door, and many bars & restuarants nearby. My other New York tip: it's almost as cheap to have a "town car" limo from JFK to central NY as it is to use train, bus etc, and so much easier.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff, great location, depressing rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mondfrau
Reviews.Content: The check-in at the Dylan and the overall impression was very positive. The entrance is very impressive and the staff very lovely. Sadly, the rooms are a little run down and mine (804) was incredibly dark. The bathroom is a delight, though with Marble throughout and measuring cups as water glasses and a Petri dish for the soap!

Reviews.Title: “ahhhhhhh”
Reviews.Author: jkruger
Reviews.Content: not really what i expected. location good, but rooms simply too small even for NY standards

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: DrPaul92
Reviews.Content: Great location near Grand Central. Albert was excellent and Denise was very helpful. The room was the biggest we have ever had in NYC at that price and the beakers are a nice touch. The steak house Benjamin's is in the hotel and is average priced for NYC. The steaks were excellent and the a la carte sides were easily shared by three but our waiter was obviously just going to give us the bare minimum service. The head waiter was attentive and probably would have addressed my concerns but I just tipped the slackard accordingly. The valet parking is $45 and pretty timely even though the lot on 33rd St. Nice elevators too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maura D
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dylan Hotel for a night with a group of friends. It is in a great location and I was very impressed by our room. It was much bigger then I imagined for staying in NYC + great value for their price. The staff was very friendly and I am definitely planning on staying here again when I return to the city!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer L
Reviews.Content: I am going back! The hotel was very nice, I loved the decor. The staff was very friendly as well. Denise at the front desk did an amazing job!

Reviews.Title: “Real character, great location”
Reviews.Author: RobinSuffolk_UK
Reviews.Content: This is an old building by NYC standards,is quite quaint and has some history.Was the Society of Chemists (and uses chemists glassware as mugs in the bathrooms, nice touch).It is quiet at night, and great location for Grand Central (where the Oyster Bar downstairs is a truly GREAT retaurant, and so easy to miss it if you don't know it's there.Thankfully we were tipped off by a friend). The breakfast was moderate at best, bread a bit stale, fruit a bit tasteless, and the waiting staff in the morning were fairly surly, presumably having been up late in the Steakhouse the night before?? (which we had 2 meals in and was brilliant). One time when we had been there at breakfast for 10 minutes with no drinks offered , we asked for some coffe and water and were told 'Just wait a minute will you ??'.Eventually had to get the water ourselves.If we stayed here again we would breakfast out, so much choice in NYC one doesn't have to put up with sulky staff and stale croissants for breakfast, especially as its $18 per person extra.There's a great diner just opposite the station in Pershing square where we 'jumped ship' and ate on the last day, even though we had paid at the Dylan , and it was worth it, really geat NYC style breakfast, cheerful staff, and a real buzz about the place, but gets full, so go early. Room was clean a little bit 'worn' , and far too hot at night, with no heater control, but was quiet , thick old walls, no noise from the street or other rooms.With the excellent Benjamin Steak House at night, and the perfect location ,we would certainly visit again,and just skip the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Jobobo
Reviews.Content: I have stayed several times in the last couple months. If you need a place to stay in grand central madison avenue area, this is definitely a good option. I stayed in the executive room each time and had a nice king bed, high floor room, which was quiet and comfortable. The room was a decent size as well. My only complaint was the plumbing, the shower would scald me for 1 second every morning. That could easily be fixed with a modern higher quality water regulator.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel close to Grand Central”
Reviews.Author: TaipeiTim
Reviews.Content: This is a very, quiet and comfortable hotel that's walking distance to Grand Central station, and many subway links. We easily walked to the Empire State Building, Times Square, and Gershwin theater,with many bars and restaurants in between. The 4, 5 and 6 trails from GCS also take north or south in few minutes, which we used for a visit to the Statue of Liberty. Benjamin's is the hotel's restaurant and has an OK breakfast, but the reputation as one of the City's best steak houses, and it seemed like the Friday and Saturday nights we stuck or noses in (we were more up for Italian). We ended up at Salute about 2 blocks from the Hotel (hotel recommended), and it was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “HUGE ROOMS, GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: stephen b
Reviews.Content: 1 block from Grand Central Station, NY Public Library and Bryant Park. Large rooms, Minimal views but great central location to Uptown. Walk to 30 Rock, Central Park, Empire State Bldg. Finicky elevators and un-air conditioned hallways but nice old flavor otherwise. Went for 2 days in August and the city was 100F both days!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmnonLondon
Reviews.Content: Absolutely nothing wrong with the Dylan - rooms are ok, not luxurious but clean and reasonably stylish though could do with a refit soon. The main benefit of the hotel is its brilliant location next to Grand Central Station: it's so easy to use as a base for exploring the city and region. Benjamin's steakhouse (adjoining) best avoided, especially by vegetarians.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jakki o
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here for 2 nights in January. The staff were very helpful and accomodating at all times. Originally when we checked in at noon they said that if we needed a room right away, they could only give us one at the back of the hotel with no view but if we waited till check-in time we would get a better room. So we waited but I guess we were given a room at the back of the hotel with a view of offices and air-conditioning units! Even though it was the weekend we didnt dare open the curtins as the offices were really close. The room was really small but comfortable, especially the bed. The furniture was dated and marked and scuffed up badly. bathroom decent enough. You can walk everywhere, all shopping, restaurants and tourist attractions are within minutes of the hotel. For a great breakfast and friendly staff check out Delmonicas deli on Lexington Ave., (although they are closed on Sundays). I would definatly stay here again, got a better deal by going directly through the hotel than on Kayak which was surprising!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CybilRose
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the Dylan Hotel for size and price (at least during January). I have a huge bathroom and bedroom - in New York City! Not to mention that it is steps away from Grand Central, the Chrysler Building, Rock Center and tons of shopping. The front desk is helpful and there is free wi-fi. Love it!

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service experience in NYC”
Reviews.Author: MitchellMouse
Reviews.Content: I travel for business and stay in hotels regularly. I'm used to snotty or aloof customer service. I arrived at the hotel befire check in. Denise treated me respectfully, explained several options and found a great solution. Her honest and kind approach was refreshing. Nicely done!

Reviews.Title: “Five good nights”
Reviews.Author: Spitak
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us by friends who had stayed here. It has a great location. We were quite satisfied with our stay,a comfortable, clean bed with crisp sheets and good towels in a clean bathroom being most important. Service was correct and friendly.The fact that there was no view from our room except into office rooms of the building just across was not dramatic, because you don't stay in your room all day in New York! More of a problem was the noise and smell from the vent of the restaurant,when you opened the window. We did not have breakfast at the hotel, but preferred to go to the " le pain quotidien", near the library . The menu is healthier ,tastier,cheaper and the place has much more ambiance. We payed much more than mentioned in the other review...

Reviews.Title: “Nice place in need of a bit of work”
Reviews.Author: Cefnhendre
Reviews.Content: We arrived late in the evening in New York to find our room had been upgraded to a Kingsize which was a nice bonus, especially as we were on our honeymoon. The room was in need of some TLC though. Fitments on the furniture were coming loose, the trim around the shower fell away, they bath plug leaked water and the bath tap constantly dripped. One of the light switches didn't work and the towel hook was loose, so towels fell on the floor. The vast majority of the time we were out and about exploring New York, and it was a good thing, as the room temperature was far too high.There is no seperate heating per room, its either heated in the winter, or cooled in the summer. Thankfully we were on the top floor, as we needed both sets of windows open to make the room comfortable. Any lower would have meant sleeping at night would have been difficult because of noise from the streets below. On the plus side, a great location, near to Grand Central Station, with midtown a comfortable stroll away. Uptown and Downtown were within easy reach either by metro or by foot. The staff were attentive at all times and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Two strong positives make up for a few negatives”
Reviews.Author: KF3000
Reviews.Content: I booked a junior suite for an overnight stay with my wife and our 2 kids. The 2 big pluses with the Dylan are location and price. Broadway and Times Square are a short walk away. The price was good -- we got the junior suite (a king size bed, a pullout full size bed, and we got a rollaway cot), for $230 US, plus $30 for the cot. Other pluses are the free wifi, good service, minibar (pricey, but nice to have), very clean room with comfortable king bed. Some minuses: a small bathroom, no thermostat in the room (it got pretty cold), room needed a paint job, the pull out bed was very uncomfortable. There are better hotels in NY. But for the price and location, I would recommend the Dylan for a good night's stay in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel in early 20th century building”
Reviews.Author: Simon63
Reviews.Content: Excellent boutique type hotel. Comfortable rooms and reasonably sized for New York. Complimentary WIFI was good. Why cant all hotels include it? Not to do so is like charging hot water as an extra. Well located just below Grand Union Station and its transport hub with many restaurants in easy walking distance. No views over New York as there are larger buildings all around. Its convenience makes up for this. This staff were friendly and helpful. My only grumble was that there was no chilling on the 'Winter' setting to the air conditioner in the room and it pumped out (very) hot air when on. At least it could be turned off and the window opened. I cant see why it couldn't allow for chilling too. I did not try the Benjamin Steakhouse on the ground floor but it looked good and was clearly popular. There was a separate entrance for non hotel clients although there was also direct access for hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelNurses2
Reviews.Content: Pretty cool place....staff nice and helpful, clean room. Small but hey...thats NYC. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location spacious rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Mumazilla
Reviews.Content: As a recommendation from a friend we stayed here 7 nights in early December. Having stayed at various NY hotels previously I was initially impressed with the size of the rooms. We stayed on the 8th floor. The bathroom was a fair size, with great water pressure. The bed was soft and comfortable. Room was very clean. From reading past reviews we learned the heating was an issue so we decided to turn off the heating and leave the window open a fraction which worked a treat. Room service was prompt although the food was not great. I did not have any problem with the staff at reception at all. They were always helpful and attentive. Overall our stay was a good one. The best feature is the proximity to everything. The subway a short stroll away, and great restaurants nearby. The only negative is they advertised for a complimentary paper each day...we didn't see one in 7 days.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: Rob A
Reviews.Content: There isn't a thermostat in the room. Rooms are small. Not all of the electrical outlets in the room worked. The bed was all springs, no padding. Only stayed in room for 10 mins, long enough to look for another hotel. Went to check out, and management told me that they are only required by NY law to provide heat after Oct15th. There is no regulation of how much and you don't get air. Look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: maryellen k
Reviews.Content: I needed a place to stay for 1 night in Manhattan while my husband was in the hospital. We made a corporate reservation through my husband's office. After a full day in the hospital i arrived at the boutique hotel with a quick and easy check in (i noticed it was attached to The Benjamin, great spot for an evening coctail or dinner next time). I slept like a baby, the shower was great, breakfast was delicious and the doorman found me a cab to get back to the hospital. The intimate setting, small lobby and great service made the stay very relaxing. I look forward to staying there with my husband or some girlfriends for a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service and room was spacious”
Reviews.Author: Canucks301
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 nights last week for business travel. Was booked under corporate rate but still over USD 300 per night. Location was great very close to Grand Central Station but on side streets rather than on Park Avenue and the building itself is not really eye catching. My colleague stayed at 70 PARK AVENUE HOTEL which has a much better appearance from outside. Unfortunately I booked a week later than my colleague and the corporate rate class for around $300+ was not available and the next rate class was already over $500. The room was quite spacious, including the washroom. I got 2 queen size beds, free internet (they also support WIFI but I only used the LAN cable). The staff was very friendly and helpful. Only a small complain seems the air conditioning is preset so I could not adjust the temperature making it warmer or cooler. Other than that as a business traveler I am quite happy with the hotel as my first priority is location.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond disappointing, would not recommend it & will never stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Schnucs
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights a few weeks ago. Firstly I requested a quiet room and was given a room on 2nd floor where restaurant is and also just off the street. The shower was great in this room but sleep is more important so requested to move. We were moved to 12th floor and shower was horrible (i.e. very little water pressure and was very low on wall) but the room was quieter. The beds in the rooms were small and uncomfortable. The plugs were hanging out of the wall. The AC is centrally located so had no control over it. I rang reception/guest services a few times for various issues and they were rude and unhelpful each time, it seemed like a big hassle for most of them to help with anything. The good points: It is a very good location, right near NY Library and Bryant Park. Some staff were helpful, especially as we were leaving, which I found interesting. Free wifi was a major plus. 3 of us stayed there and all of us were disappointed, as I say above I will never ever stay there again and will never recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Movie hotel”
Reviews.Author: flak059
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Dylan on august, 2008. This modern hotel is well situated, fashionable, quiet and pleasant. What I greatly liked that I booked everything from their site including limousine to the airport (hate taxis especially in NY) that waited 1.5 hours while I was passing through customs. Pity thing they block too much money on card, but I consider that most of US hotels do.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: AndyHunn
Reviews.Content: I don't expect much from new york hotels. Clean bed, and decent shower. They got half right. Bed was fine. small but clean room. But on morning wake up all went downhill: - Shower had no water pressure, had to lean against wall under shower to wash my hair, while standing in ankle deep water - Temperature controls in room didn't work - cold - No access to any power outlets without digging under desk or bed, outlet embedded in the desk didn't work. Ironing is a pain without these hassles, all i need to get my day started is crawling around under the desk... Stayed in room 701, choose another. Look you can't expect much in new york for $300, which is the deal we got on this room, but I do expect the basics of hotel life for business person. Shouldn't be this hard.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: smith5
Reviews.Content: The Dylan hotel is a small jewel tucked in near New York library. It is a central location and near Bryant park, great restaurants and the hotel is clean,quiet and great for an overnighter!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty & Noisy”
Reviews.Author: BethA448
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Dylan Hotel this week while traveling to NY for work & it was not a good experience. There was MAJOR construction noise outside the hotel midnight - 2:30am. There was mold lined around the bottom of the shower & the water pressure bad. the chair in the room had icky stains on it, the lamp next to the bed didnt work,and even the carpet was worn and dirty looking. Ick.

Reviews.Title: “great when I can get a good rate”
Reviews.Author: ramblegal
Reviews.Content: have stayed several times on business, once through the weekend. keep coming back because (1) breakfast by the fireplace can't be beat, (2) friendly staff, (3) comfortable beds, (3) coffee/tea in room, (4) great location, (5) modern shower/etc. never can quite get the wifi to work, but it is free, I think it depends what floor you are on.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable quiet room, free breakfast, delightful people”
Reviews.Author: Carla D
Reviews.Content: The front desk friends at this hotel are...amazing...or obviously I wouldn't use the term friends. But, Raymond and Frantz? Amazing amazing customer service...they're top concierge service in a small hotel. Rooms are comfortable, beds delicious. Few oddities about staying here but nothing that balances negative by a long shot. Great hotel in this area of mid-town - block from Grand Central. Plus, just down the street is Mai and it's exceptionally good sushi in a low key restaurant. Raymond suggested I go there. He will do you right. Plus, I didn't think about it til seeing t he ratings, but the rooms are quiet. Lovely quiet when you're trying to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous little find!”
Reviews.Author: klive7
Reviews.Content: For the price (through booking.com), the hotel was terrific on location, friendliness and attentiveness of staff, cleanliness, and comfort. The bathroom was modern, the linens were welcoming after a long day of sight seeing. The tv was huge. The room was remarkably quiet. Room service was prompt. Water pressure was great. Room temp perfect. There was a fridge in the room. We were charged, incorrectly, for an item from the mini-bar: no problem and no hassle having it removed from the bill. There is no ice dispenser but whenever we asked for ice from the front desk it was delivered within two minutes. But most importantly, we needed two beds, which can be hard to find in NYC on a budget, and sure enough that's what we got. I would stay here again without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “If you can get it cheap, its a great choice!”
Reviews.Author: femaletraveler24
Reviews.Content: We stayed in DYLAN hotel after booking with booking.com. We got a great deal for an executive King room and stayed here for 6 nights. Overall I can say that DYLAN is a very good choice. I wouldn't pay full price though. For a good rate we got a large room with kingsize bed. The bed was really comfy. Next to the bed was a docking station for Ipod wich you can also use as alarmclock. In front of the bed there was a flatscreen TV. The room had carpet, I personally don't like carpet so I never walked barefoot in the room. From the room we had a view on a window of an office. You can not ask for a stunning view for this price! I was glad we didn't face a brick wall or alley with carbage cans. The marble bathroom is very big! There is a seperate shower and a bathtub. There were towels and slippers available for our use. Lots of boutique hotels are very noisy, this one was not! We slept on the third floor. There is an elevator to bring you to your floor. The hotel is located in a quiet street, although very central. We didn't have breakfast because there are numerous places in town to eat. Starbucks is around every corner. Around the corner, on one side is Grand Central Terminal. Go the other way and you will cross Bryant park and the library. Across the hotel you can take the subway. More subways stop at GCT, so thats a good option too. It takes a ten minute walk to get to Times Square. To get to the Brooklyn Bridge, Battery park, Ground zero, etc. you better take the subway. Overall I loved the hotel we stayed in because it was cheap, had a GREAT location and it was VERY clean, quiet and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Byant Park location”
Reviews.Author: Suesuesayshi
Reviews.Content: This is a small,terrific hotel that has a terrific central locations.Rooms are comfortable, clean and a nice style..Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected but nice”
Reviews.Author: jonandsueBelfast
Reviews.Content: We booked this Hotel as they say they are on 5th Ave, they are not, they are on the next Ave, ok no biggy but if your a tourist you expect to stay where it is advertised. Anyway, hotel is in the old chemists club, very small boutique type. We were given a room at the back of the building even though we were staying 7 days!!! Was an ok room except the office workers in the building next door were looking in on the weekdays, so we had to draw the curtains on the 7th floor!!! The room was shabby furniture badly chippe, stained carpets and torn bedding!! There was no ice machine so you had to send for ice and then he tipped it into the smallest ice bucket! The restaurant was a Steak House $$$$$ we went and ate elsewhere. We got them to organise a cab for us back to the airport, the guy slowed down and ordered a hot dog whilst driving!!! had his radio blaring out and kept answering his phone!!! Needless to say his tip wasn't very big!!! Hotel was ok, just ok, theres MANY better hotels in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: spankygem
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days, brilliant location. Didn't have to get on one subway- all major tourist attractions walking distance. Our travel agent messed up our reservation too but the hotel staff were very helpful and made our stay enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Solid NYC Hotel, great location, quiet rooms.”
Reviews.Author: ifly737
Reviews.Content: I would give the Dylan 4 stars but they committed a cardinal sin for hotels and had no hot water on our last morning. Staff explained that they reset the system and wait 30 minutes, sorry we didn't have 30 minutes with a flight to catch. On the up side the rooms are a good size for NYC. Hotel was VERY quiet on a side street. Convenient location to all things in Manhatten. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've visited”
Reviews.Author: hduran69
Reviews.Content: The staying at this place was awful. Chipped furntiure, disgusting carpets, and unkempt. It's a rundown hotel that needs more than a decent renovation. The fonrt desk staff was rude, unattentive and unhelpful. When I tried to complain to their manager it was much worse. She replied with an aggresiveness and a bad attitude that was really amazing. I definetely will not recommend this place to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy but needs a facelift”
Reviews.Author: Cherie2812
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff are very welcoming, they make up for the updates that this hotel needs. I stayed in a room that had ceiling to floor drapes but found the windows behind the curtains to be opaque so I had no natural like and I felt like I was in a box after that. The shower had very good water pressure. I had poor phone reception, I actually had to step out into the hallway to use my phone one time! The continental breakfast was abundant and the wait staff were exceptionally friendly and took care of me. I felt like this hotel was a cozy boutique style hotel in the past, but no money has been put into it for improvements for awhile.

Reviews.Title: “The best bachelorette trip ever!”
Reviews.Author: Fei26
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Dylan hotel for 8 days, we were 4 friends that decided to go on a trip to NY from Greece since I am getting married on July. And we had an incredible time there! As far the hotel is concerned I have to say that compared to other more expensive hotels it was worth it, its a crystal clear value for money option for those who wish to have a safe, comfortable stay in a great location and not spend a fortune. For me, when I travel to places were I just spent the night in the room cause all the other hours of the day I am out, I need a good hotel just like this. Things to help you: its 1 min. away from grand central station (trains, metro etc.), it has a restaurant in the ground foor were celebrities go for steaks (very good ) and it also serves breakfast. For something cheaper almost next to the hotel there is a Starbucks and at the first corner of 5th Avenue there is a Devon & Blakely coffee and Deli that will satisfy even the most difficult demand. The hotel is 2 min. walk to 5th Avenue and all its shops, 1 min. walk from Madison and 3 min. walk to the public library (where Carrie almost got married) and at the back of the library you will find a great park called Bryant park. From there another 2 min. walk and you are in Times Square. Also, it is 4 min. walk from the Empire State Building and the Rockfeller tower. I mean I have travelled a lot, this hotel had the greatest location ever! Moreover, its 5 min. walk to the port authority bus terminal where you can get a bus to go to Woodbury common outlet and shop till you drop all the brands you can imagine in prices that will make your heart stop! We walked everyday to Central park , it is 15 min. maximum walk on foot and especially on the weekends with a good weather its a must! Don't leave NY without eating in Burger Joint (its inside the hotel Le parker Meridien, but its not formal at all, its behind some red curtains, very unformal, u will have a good laugh and the best burger ever!). Take the metro and go to West Village and Soho, have a simple yellow cupcake with pink icing or a slice of the coconut cake at Amy's bread in Bleecker Street (i tried the Magnolias Bakery also but Amy won..). We also ate at Benjamin Steakhouse at the hotel, the price is approximately 40 $ each but I think its worth it even once. The room has two double beds so the remaining space was ok before shopping. After shopping we kind of climbed over piles of bags in order to go to the other side. The hotel offers driving you to the airport you like (maybe also pick you up) at a good price and for anything we wanted they assisted us with professionalism. There was only one point I didnt enjoy. Though it has free Wifi the signal was on and off every 5 minutes and that became a bit irritating after a while when we searched for a place to go or visit or information in our laptop or iphone. But, they do have a computer in the lobby with Internet that you can use for free as much as you want. Generally, I would highly recommend this hotel to all those who want to have a great and affordable stay in NY, I will also upload pictures for all of you who want to see them.

Reviews.Title: “Great place when staying in New York”
Reviews.Author: MLGU
Reviews.Content: Great Location, Clean, Nice Design, Friendly, Free Internet, For NY real Great Value for Mmoney. Without hesitation would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe great for vacation, horrible for business.”
Reviews.Author: Xfortythreex
Reviews.Content: Zero reception in these rooms. Wifi drops in and out. Television never worked. Three business partners of mine had the same experience. Made it very hard to work. Location was great though.

Reviews.Title: “Expected cleaner, more contemporary room for the $$”
Reviews.Author: JBUDAI
Reviews.Content: Nice amenities, fantastic location, disgusting bedding. It was probably clean but the stained bed skirt squished me right out. Overly aggressive early morning room service loud enough to disturb anyone on the floor regardless of privacy requests was also extremely annoying. I would expect this in a cheaper hote. Not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice!”
Reviews.Author: DCDanielDC
Reviews.Content: From the moment we made the first call to confirm our reservation, the staff proved to be very helpful and friendly (unlike traditional hotel chains). When we arrived, we were greeted by a very nice gentleman called Steven. Over the next couple of days, an exceptional lady called Janet provided outstanding customer service; every time we contacted her se made sure our expectations were met (we asked multiple times anything from directions, to restaurants, to city tours and shows, and even coupons to park our vehicle, etc). We had a very pleasant stay. Our rooms on the third floor were just fine and comfortable (remember this is NYC). The one thing I didn’t like was a statement the morning we were leaving, which showed our credit card was charged more than it should have. Again, I approached Janet and she refunded our money and also apologized for the mistake someone else had made. Undoubtedly, I’ll recommend and stay at the Dylan again.

Reviews.Title: “funky, small with a great location”
Reviews.Author: shari-doo
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out, everything was as it should be. staff was extremely pleasant, helpful. cleaning staff was excellent, accomodating, polite. desk staff was efficient, friendly, helpful. Vibe was cool , chic without overdoing it - very convenient to all my mid-town business appointments and the train station. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location!”
Reviews.Author: oiboy86
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my girlfriend for 3 nights. I booked the executive king room with jaccuzi soaking tub and view. My flight arrived at 6am so I called the hotel and told them if I could check in early. They were very friendly and in fact asked me to come in. I arrived at the hotel and guess what? I had a room ready for me. Check in time: 1min. clean room with O.K. space. You walk out of the hotel and less than a block, you have grand central station. Although the weather was freezing (6 degrees), our room was very warm and we could adjust the temperature. I did not have any problem with the hotel. The staff cared and whatever we requested, they prepared for us. The only thing is that they have a strict 12pm check out policy so make sure you tell them in advance if you want to extend that. Overall, if you want to have a good time and stay in a 4 star hotel in the middle of all the attractions, stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Think Twice - It's Alright”
Reviews.Author: Skills2802
Reviews.Content: This was exactly what we needed as a base to explore New York. Look it's a little tired in places and quirky in others but for my 17 year old son and I it was alright. Actually better than alright. The staff were great, check in a tad slow, but apart from that very helpful and we were always greeted with a smile. Nothing was too much trouble, the room was small but had two very comfortable double beds. The bathroom seemed to be bigger than the bedroom and again was clean, great water pressure and toasty warm. We didn't dine in the steakhouse at the back of the lobby simply because we were always out and about at meal times. I did have a few beers there at the end of the night and was always warmly welcomed, even by the 'New Jersey types'. (See previous review) As for breakfast, walk out of the hotel, turn right, and there's a great deli just 6m away. Keeping walking, turn left and there's a fantastic diner just across from Grand Central. Hey, this is New York. There's a swag of great diners within walking distance. All the mid-town go-sees are within walking distance, Times Square, Central Park, Top of the Rock, Empire State and for the subway Grand Central is minutes away. We had a few scratch your head moments. In the bathroom were the usual 'towels on the floor get washed - put your towel on the towel rail to save fifty dolphins. Em there wasn't a towel rail. Great coffee machine with yummy looking coffee. Nowhere even remotely close to plug it in. Why are there coat hooks on the roof of both the lifts? All in all no major complaints, very few minor ones. Getting the bill on the morning we left was a real eyebrow raiser. I assumed that the price I was quoted on the net would have a zillion percent uplift for taxes but it was almost to the dime of the final bill. In summary - friendly, hugely convenient, clean and definitely value for money. So don't think twice - it's alright. (Dylan - get it?)

Reviews.Title: “Gone downhill”
Reviews.Author: quickgirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few years ago and it was expensive but clean, hip, interesting. This trip, thought I'd splurge and go back. It wasn't quite as expensive which I chalked up to the recession but actually, I think it's because it's become a bit shabby. Loud, jersey=shore type crowd in bar, suspect stains on carpet and linens, holiday inn quality amenities. It's off my list.

Reviews.Title: “Steaming out of my room”
Reviews.Author: Alfieinthekennel
Reviews.Content: I arrived on a cold day and when I got to my room it was steaming hot. When I turned on the airco more hot air was blown into the room. Ended up leaving my window open for the whole of my stay. Unfortunately the heating worked so well that this had hardly any effect! As a result I didn't have much sleep as the heat kept waking me up. The room itself was well presented and clean. The main down side is that there was little room to leave your suitcase unless you unpack it for the trip. Staff at reception were very friendly and ready to help. Restaurant was a tale of two extreme's. We had a very good dinner there. However stay clear from breakfast. Not only was is it extorntionate for a mediocre breakfast buffet, the staff were clueless.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CheshireCat99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September as a 21st gift for our son. This was his first time in New York and we wanted him to love it as much as we do. First impressions, reception area was tidy but a bit shabby. Receptionist was very friendly and efficient. The rooms were a fair enough size and clean, bathroom the same so no problems so far. The location was great, just off Madison and around the corner from Grand Central Station. Ideal base for a sightseeing trip. The hotel does not have a breakfast service so you can use the bar next door - which is in fact part of the hotel building so I didn't really get that. The breakfast was a tad expensive but a fair selection, although we didn't find the staff overly welcoming. (For the same price I recommend you walk around the corner, opposite Grand Central Station Pershing Square, a fabulous place for a real New York Breakfast, the buzz in there is great.) On the day we were leaving we left the bags to be locked up until it was time t leave, only issue we had really was the receptions reluctance to organise a cab to the airport. They told us to walk over to Grand Central They did however offer to book us a private limo with a set price. We did book it but I was worried all the way to the airport that we were about to get ripped off. Worry not, we had a lovely car, pleasant driver and he charged us the agreed fee. So all in all it was a great trip and no problems with the hotel. That is until a week after our return I find the sum of £150 being held on my account , This was the amount they hold on your arrival in case you should run up a bill of any sorts. All our bills were paid in full, in cash on the day of our departure. It took me 3 days and several phone calls and e-mails, some of which the staff were rude, to get this money back. Never had this happen before, and it would put me off returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great time in nyc”
Reviews.Author: ruthyTelAviv
Reviews.Content: the hotel was in very good location near grand central the room was very nice and we had a real nice vacation

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed as it was a honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: pobrien2009
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay in this hotel after travelling from Orlando. We were on honeymoon and spent half our time in Orlando and half in New York. When we arrived at reception, we were 1 hour earlier than check in. A lovely man greeted us and helped us with our bags. When we went up to reception, the receptionist was rude and hardly lifted her head from the computer to say hello or anything else. She rudely told us to come back at check-in time which was 1 hour. Luckily, the young man saw this and took our luggage and put it in a holding area. We returned in an hour and a half and her attitude didnt change. She just checked us in and told us where the lift was. She didnt explain any of the facilities of the hotel or anything. We took the lift up to our room. When we arrived at our room, we couldnt get our suitcases in through the door without moving the furniture out of the way. The room was a pokey little box. The bathroom was small but it had a clean shower. The bedroom was tiny. We had to move our furniture and store our suitcases under the table in the bedroom. We were only staying 5 nights here and it was long enough. I wouldnt remommend this hotel to anyone, and especially with it being our honeymoon we were very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & Staff”
Reviews.Author: barcelona248
Reviews.Content: Staff is very friendly and helpfull. The rooms are big compare to other hotels. The rooms are comfortable and clean. The front desk staff gave us lots of recomendatios for restaurants. We tried to check in at 9 am but unfortunately room were not available becuase check in time is 3pm. The Bellsatf help us to storage our bags with no problems. We are definitaly come back to the hotel, I think some of the comments in this site mislead people and are not fair

Reviews.Title: “Poor value hotel”
Reviews.Author: scotsontourz
Reviews.Content: Stayed in early Nov for 5 nights. Service was friendly but nothing spectacular given the great service you receive in other New York hotels. Room was good size and clean but so, so dark with the lights so dim always felt dark in the room. Bathroom was very good size - no bath just shower - very weak water pressure. There is a gym but it is absolutely tiny with only a few peices of equipment cramped into the room. Free wifi and decent internet connection. Overall not great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Dylan Is The Worst Hotel in New York!”
Reviews.Author: mmipcvab
Reviews.Content: One of my worst hotel experiences ever. Housekeeping was awfull, the bathroom was not stocked with basic ameneties -towels,bathrobe, soap, etc. The electrical sockets sparked and flashed upon anything in to them and my message to the general manager was ignored completely. On my last day I requested a late check-out for 2pm which confirmed by the receptionist, however, at 1230 another staff member called and asked that we vacate the room in 30 minutes, when I brought up the confirmation, the response was that it was not valid!!! Don't stay here there are plenty of good hotels in the city for $400 a night.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Option in Midtown”
Reviews.Author: BizTraveller1965
Reviews.Content: I recently spent nearly a week at the Dylan. It was the first time I have stayed at the hotel and I will definitely go back!!! The hotel is 1 block from Grand Central Station and 1 block fro Bryant Park. Considering you are smack in the middle of Mid-town, the hotel is really quiet and low key. I loved the breakfast and while most days I took the healthy approach, there were a few days that I could not help myself and did a deep dive into the bacon. Actually, I cannot remember the last time I ate bacon that was so crispy and perfect!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good find; others tell us Midwesterners it was a good price.”
Reviews.Author: Jean023
Reviews.Content: Nice location for getting food at Grand Central Station or the next door deli. (On-site restaurant seemed expensive). About 10 blocks to Times Square, so fine for walkers. Room was very comfortable, and "Gone with the Wind" draperies! Not much place to put "stuff" in the bathroom. Never saw a sign of service people. We found it quiet. Hotel personnel were friendly enough, but did not seem too knowledgeable about getting taxis or a bus. Lobby area was alot "less" than appeared in the website photos.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in very handy location”
Reviews.Author: Lottielots
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 week this September. The hotel is really easy to find as it's one block from Grand Central Station. This makes getting around town very easy if you use the subway. The main attractions such as Times Square, Chrysler, Empire State etc are all walkable. The hotel is very stylish and the staff very friendly. The room was big by New York standards and there isn't anything i could complain about. The beds are the most comfortable I've had at a hotel. The restaurant within the hotel was always busy but a bit above our price tag. We did have a drink at the bar though which is very sophisticated. If you want something stylish, central and somewhere that makes you feel a bit special then I would thoroughly recommend this hotel. Eating anywhere in this area is expensive but if you get the subway to another part of town it's a bit cheaper. I would suggest visiting Bryants Park just down the road for a coffee if you want somehwere to chill out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: DrPleishner
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Dylan hotel for 2 nights in the end of August 2010. I have chosen this hotel primarily because of its location. We needed to be close enough to both Penn Station and Grand Central. Dylan proved to be absolutely perfect for this. Overall I would definitely recommend it. It was clean, staff was friendly, rooms were OK size, a bed was quite comfortable. They have free wireless Internet (I assume on each floor). Three caveats I want to mention. The shower doesn't have a door and half of it is completely open. It presents two challenges: first, it's impossible to turn water on without getting into a shower, so you need to turn it on and jump away; second, everything around you gets wet. Second caveat is that shower is quite complicated to operate - my wife couldn't figure it out on her own and called me to help her. The third little problem is that our room was on the "inside" wall. Windows do not open and there are heavy drapes on the windows. It's hard to tell whether it's day or night outside. I figured we'd wake up on our own and didn't set the alarm clock. Of course both my wife and I kept thinking it's still too early because it seemed completely dark outside but in fact it was 9 AM already. So next day we set the alarm. Again, overall this hotel is very nice. I never stayed in New York before but if compare this hotel to other hotels in large cities around the world this one is a winner.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: Mucca212
Reviews.Content: This is a great place. The poor reviews here seem to be a few years old so I would not take them into consideration. I really can't see what someone could complain about except perhaps the view from the room if you were really hoping for something great and got an interior view instead of a street view. The hotel has a lot of style and the room, while smallish, was well-thought out and very comfortable. Lots of little nice touches, like the beaker glasses in the bathroom because the building used to be the Chemists' Club. Staff was very friendly. There was valet parking for $45+tax per night. Location is great. One block from Grand Central but on a nice, side street. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Central Hub for Big apple tourism”
Reviews.Author: brigibbo
Reviews.Content: A wonderful location for me and my daughter's 4 night stay in New York. The hotel staff were wonderful and nothing was ever a problem even making our stay memorable with a room upgrade because of my daughters graduation from university (the reason for out trip I may add) Grand central, Empire State building and Rock plaza were within walking distance in fact most of the "attractions" were within walking distance from this hotel. Minor gripe and it is only minor - when rainfall came (and it did) there was an umbrella in the room, it would have been great to have used it free gratis instead it cost $15. Would stay again and would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: HamishInOttawa
Reviews.Content: A four night stay at the Dylan hotel turned out to be one of the best decisions of my whole vacation plan. The location is excellent, only a block or two from Grand Central and far enough from the bustle of Times Square to retain some dignity. We were upgraded to a king size bed without prompting and enjoyed a good sized room, spotlessly clean, with a nice array of complimentary items. Requests for extra pillows and towels were met immediately and all the staff we interacted with were friendly and helpful. We didn't eat at the hotel, preferring to explore the many local options for breakfast and dinner, but the decor and atmosphere of the steakhouse were striking. I would certainly stay there for future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Grey_Stack
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of marginal reviews, but I got to say - for a Manhattan hotel this close to Grand Central the Dylan is a great hotel for the price. Rooms are decent size by Manhattan standards, they have been renovated recently and are nice. The staff was decent. Anyone expecting a room with a vew at this price point is crazy. I booked at 1800 hotels and got a pretty good price. The Benjamin Steak House on the ground floor is good - but not cheap. A very short block to Grand Central and 2 blocks to the New York Library. The Hyatt and the Library, both equally close to Grand Central are $100 more a night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, perfect staff and perfect rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Shopaholic1980_03
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from the most amazing stay at the Dylan Hotel. We were in New York for a total of 4 nights. The location of the hotel is perfect. Just one block away from Grand Central Station and the Crysler Building and a 5 minute walk from the New York Public Library (Empire State Building and Times Square are 10 mins away!!!). Staff were extremely helpful and friendly. My best friend and I were celebrating our 30th birthdays and had travelled with our mums. We requested rooms close together on checkin and they accomodated us in an adjoining room with an interconnecting door on the second night. We checked into our temporary room on the first night and would have been happy to stay there as it was more than adequate. However, we left our cases packed the next morning and when we returned from a day our in NYC the staff had moved everything for us and we had the freedom of the interconnecting rooms with two queen beds in each room! Amazing!! The flatscreen tv, ipod dock, spotless showerooms, plenty of toiletries, iron and ironing board, mini bar, complimentary slippers and robe, turn down service and chocolates were all unexpected added extras as we hadn't paid over the odds for our rooms. Anyone who stays in this hotel will have the most perfect time in New York!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Puakoa
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly, helpful and accommodating. - I enjoyed all my contacts with them. I stayed in two different rooms. Both were very attractive with all the usual amenities (shampoo, safe, etc). The first room was a little strange - the only shower I've used in a hotel with no place to set soaps, shampoo, etc, and no place to set cosmetics/toothbrush/etc in the bathroom area. However, I asked to change rooms the next day and they cheerfully moved me to a different room which was excellent in all aspects. So, if you get room 305 and you brought your toothbrush with you, don't hesitate to ask for a switch! :) :) :)

Reviews.Title: “Dylan hotel- would recommend to everyone”
Reviews.Author: James_knott2
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel we were given an uprgrate to a suite on the top floor. What a room! I had heard all rooms in hotels in NYC were small, but this couldn't have been further away from this. The bedroom with brilliant with great views of the Chrysler. And the bathroom was lovely too. We found all the staff on reception really helpful, and very polite (very different to most other service we had in the city). Our flight home was delayed because of the volcano and had to move out, but the hotel were more than happy for us to use the free internet, and leave our bags with them on our final day while we organised our tickets home. This was a nice touch during this part of our stay. In terms of location it was great. Near all the main attractions, and really close to grand central station! Would definitely go back 100%, and recommend to everyone

Reviews.Title: “The Great Dylan Hotel & Steakhouse”
Reviews.Author: WendyW2
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay here. So close to Time Square, Union Station - just minutes to everything. Great Staff. The Benjamin Steak House was so great!!! The room was quiet and comfortable. Older elevators but it was okay!

Reviews.Title: “Feared the worst - definitely pleased! Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: pm_marie
Reviews.Content: I got a pretty good deal on at the Dylan through 1800hotels. After booking, I read some bad reviews on www.tripadvisor.com and tried to switch hotels. I glad I did not, I was pleased with the quality of the rooms and the hotel staff was very kind and accompanying. I through the rooms sizes were generous compared to other boutique hotels in the area. Upgraded to a king for the price of my queen rate. Free internet too. The location is great for Midtown. I would definitely stay at the Dylan Hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Good - but could do better”
Reviews.Author: areopagus88
Reviews.Content: Here's the thing: I managed to book this hotel through hotels.com for a package rate of USD143 a night plus all the assorted taxes and charges you get in New York (So the rate is probably closer to USD165 a night). This queen bedroom package included breakfast, a complimentary upgrade if possible on check in, complimentary Internet, and a bottle of wine. Pretty decent deal for Midtown Manhattan, just one block from Grand Central Station and the NY Airport Service bus stop. When I checked in, the welcome was warm enough. Nobody explained whether I was receiving an upgrade or not - I don't think I did. I got the breakfast vouchers and the bottle of wine (a run-of-the-mill cabernet sauvignon) was delivered. The room was pretty decent, though it was too hot and with no visible means to control the heat. I've had the windows open throughout my stay including the night just to keep the temperature comfortable. I've also had to have the curtains drawn closed the entire time I was in the room because the window looked out across to an office block. For a modern hotel, it was somewhat strange that the lamps had to be switched on individually and not through the wall switch. Some of the phone speed dial buttons didn't work. Housekeeping kept using far too shallow plastic trash bin liners that meant that you could hardly put anything into the trash can, less than half its actual capacity. I get how some people are upset by the lack of shelf space in the bathroom. It is somewhat strange that there really is no place to put a toilet kit. Yet another example of how designers often think only about looks and not about the needs of the guest. Housekeeping wasn't very good about replenishing toiletry supplies. I had to call down for some soap and ran out of shampoo before a new vial appeared. The chemistry theme is cute but there's no attempt in the room to explain the reasons behind it. The Internet worked fine, though at a few times service was weak. Room service (from Benjamin's Steakhouse) was good, but way too expensive - I could order the same food for delivery to my room for maybe half the price using seamlessweb.com. The fitness center is too small and cramped - and frankly a little smelly. I wondered about the security of the hotel, given that restaurant delivery people could just go straight up to the room to bring me my orders. The safe in the room is great - large enough to keep a laptop. Guest services guy on the phone was sometimes nice, sometimes rather short and cold. The buffet breakfast is not worth paying for. It all seems like an afterthought on the hotel's part. There's no effort to make the buffet any better than a school cafeteria spread - cheese singles???? chafing dishes that don't keep food hot????? Stale bread and old baked goods????? Please! The restaurant itself needs to be fixed up. It has all the charm of the refectory of a seminary. On the whole, this was a good hotel to stay in for the price I paid. Would I stay here if I were to pay peak season prices - say, USD250 or USD300? I'm not sure.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel without the Attitude”
Reviews.Author: itbetterbeclean
Reviews.Content: Timing is key. Stayed after Christmas and booked a winter special package over a quiet weekend, got room + free buffet breakfast + bottle of wine + free upgrade with tax and fees for under $189 a night. The ultimate NYC bargain. Originally booked queen luxury room, instead got free upgrade to King Executive with included a huge marble bathroom with separate Jacuzzi tub. Room is nice with high ceilings, we had great view of Chrysler Building. Flat screen is nice but not many TV stations to choose from. Room also had mini fridge. Front desk people are very good and extremely un-snobby. I called and asked for ice, it was delivered within 5 minutes in a stainless steel bucket. Extra towels ditto. Breakfast was standard hotel food, but you got to eat it at Benjamin Steakhouse (attached to Dylan), by the huge fireplace. Can't beat the location, right next to Grand Central Station. Had lunch at counter of Oyster Bar. 2 Starbucks at opposite corners.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: eyevibe
Reviews.Content: I almost did not book this hotel because of all the negative comments, but seriously I don't know what the other posters are complaining about. The hotel is situated very close to Grand Central Station which made is very accessible for us as we arrived in town via the train. We arrived extremely early and the staff allowed us to check in early! The hotel is waling distance to many parts of the City! The rooms were clean and organized. Not the biggest room, but seriously who spends their time in a room when in NYC!! The staff was very accommodating, friendly, and helpful. The only negative would be the lack of AC control in the room, however the room was kept at a pleasant temp! Overall for the price, location, and cleanliness I would recommend! We are already planning another trip with the Dylan as our Hotel of choice!

Reviews.Title: “Not at all what it should be.”
Reviews.Author: octopusofthesea
Reviews.Content: If you absolutely have to stay in midtown, there are far better options than the Dylan. My reservation at one of these other hotels got flubbed, so I called the Dylan to see what they had. They left me on hold for 15 minutes, so I hung up and called back and he said he'd forgotten about me, but didn't apologize, or act with any kind of urgency. I made a reservation and when I showed up it took half an hour to check me in. The room was decently appointed, but upon closer inspection I found holes in the dirty fabric of the chairs, making me feel like I really shouldn't sit on them. The glassware in the room was cracked. I put it outside and it was not replaced. Like every hotel, they charge an arm and a leg for everything, but that usually doesn't bother me since the company is paying. But combined with the bad service and sketchy conditions, I really found myself resenting their pricing on everything. The one plus is the Benjamin steak house. Excellent steaks. So if you're going to stay in midtown, choose the Morgan or the Library, and go eat at Benjamin steak house.

Reviews.Title: “Weeked In NYC”
Reviews.Author: TuSalsera
Reviews.Content: Great Location!! NIce restaurant bar..rooms could have been a litte bigger, but all-in-all is a lil diamond in the ruff.

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Elodieg1
Reviews.Content: definitely a good place to stay in NYC, central and quiet....

Reviews.Title: “Good for writer/reseachers”
Reviews.Author: ClintJohnson
Reviews.Content: I needed to spend several days at the New York Public library to finish research for my book - A VAST AND FIENDISH PLOT - The Confederate Attack on New York City (coming March 2010 from Kensington Press in NYC). The Dylan is only 4 blocks from the library, making this the IDEAL hotel for someone who needs to do research. The rooms were clean, if a little small, but you only sleep there. I did not try the hotel restaurant, but the prices there seemed high to me. Wife and I attended a play while in town and we walked from the hotel to the theater district. This will likely be the favored hotel when we need to come to NYC again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location at the right price!”
Reviews.Author: ronvoyage
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at the Dylan Hotel in October 2009. One block from Grand Central Station and a 10 minute walk to Times Square and the theatre district. The room was average in size for NY standards. The truffles and a nice bottle of water greated me in the room. I was impressed with the front desk staff. I needed to print a form from a memory stick and the front desk staff was happy to help. They even faxed it at no charge. Bought a half price ticket in Times Square to a new musical called Rock of Ages and really enjoyed the event! Walked back to the hotel at 10:30PM and felt safe! Ronvoyage - Sequim, WA

Reviews.Title: “Very near Grand Central Terminal”
Reviews.Author: 200NitesAYear
Reviews.Content: The Dylan hotel is a small boutique type hotel located very near the train station - Grand Central Terminal. The lobby is small but leads to a nice on-site and full service restaurant. Small elevators so can't get much luggage or people in at once. Spacious hallways and my room was very large. I don't know if my room size was typical for the property....maybe I got lucky. Room had cathedral ceilings, updated bathroom, new TV, couch and chair. My room had a safe inside the closet...very useful. My room also had plenty of hot water, a clean bathroom and a large bed. I saw a fitness center in the basement level with a very large and modern public restroom. The hotel is nice. It's not large and it wasn't very busy upon my stay. It was quiet. This is not the place to be if you need to socialize with other quests, enjoy a spacious lounge area or like to chose between multiple in-house dining options. It's very good if you need to be very close to Grand Central Terminal.

Reviews.Title: “quiet in the city”
Reviews.Author: mcb74
Reviews.Content: love this place - comfortable and quiet sanctuary on the haeart of id-town manhattan. we didnt partake of breakfast as there is so much choice right on your doorstep amongst the office workers. it was great to lie in bed a t night and listen to the fire engines cacophony up 5th avenue a couple of blocks away - peaceful little hotel - looks cool too!

Reviews.Title: “Bad service all around”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuru00
Reviews.Content: There was bad service throughout the stay at the Dylan Hotel. We had a room with no water pressure and no hot water. We called the front desk staff about this and on the second day of our stay they had engineers etc working in our room trying to fix the problem. They did not provide us with a different room, but rather had strangers working in our room during our "romantic" stay in NY. Finally by the end of the second day we finally had water in our room. When we were leaving, the valet had lost our car key. They finally found it but my boyfriend noticed that they had taken off and not returned the car antennae. We sat there waiting for them to find the antennae and, after about a one hour delay from the time we checked out, we were finally on our way. Worst hotel experience ever. I contacted the hotel manager about the hotel room experience but heard nothing back. Clearly this hotel does not care about customer opinions. So to recap: Horrible service throughout the entire stay, bad management, and just a very bad hotel in general. ABSOLUTELY do not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel. Highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: BessieLondon
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 6 night stay at The Dylan Hotel. It was our first visit to the hotel and couldn't have asked for more. The welcome was warm, the staff incredibly helpful and friendly. The room was superb-an unusually large room for New York. The Dylan is ideally located for a New York visit-it is in the heart of the city. Close to many fine restaurants. Easy to get to and from all major sights. If needed there is a bus to and from all NY airports a 2 minute walk from the hotel- $15 one way, or $27 return. I will definitely recommend the Dylan to friends and family, and also book to stay there on my next trip. A gem of a hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the location but that was all”
Reviews.Author: Clementine6
Reviews.Content: I hated this hotel. It claims to have 4 stars but at least three of them were hiding when I was there. It was 80+ degrees in my room and they couldnt do anything about it. Not much point in staying in a hotel where it is too uncomfortable to sleep. I flung all the windows open (it was cool outside) but it didnt really help. The room was dingy, tarted up with a few new fittings but tired looking underneath, Old dingy chipped furniture, horrible carpet and cheap looking curtains. But the free wireless internet worked - for a few minutes at a time. The showers are positively dangerous. Dont turn the temp up too high - because if you need to turn it down you wont be able to turn th eknob with wet hands. Awful

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable stay at the Dylan”
Reviews.Author: digitpx
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two weeks ago and got a super rate. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and found our room to be comfortable and clean. Our room was larger than other hotels in NYC. I thought the bathrooms were fine and the shower was great. The design of the hotel is elegant. The service was fine. When we arrived, we were placed towards the back of the hotel and the management kindly moved us to the front of the hotel the next day at our request. We weren't bothered by any noise from the air conditioner or the outside in either room. We also figured out how to adjust the temperature in our room. You simply have to open the little gray door in the heater panel and adjust it to your comfort level. My only complaint is that the lobby had a horrible smell. We had to hold our breath on the way to the elevator. I'm not sure what the smell was and we never followed up with reception to find out what it was. Hopefully it was temporary. Beyond the smell, the lobby could be made cozier or more comfortable somehow. I would stay here again, but only at a discounted rate.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe too old for The Dylan?”
Reviews.Author: AZWayfarer
Reviews.Content: As a new Trip Advisor Member I want to write a review of my stay at The Dylan in June '08. I'm pretty well travelled, done posh and not so posh, and am over 50. I think the Dylan needs some TLC. I was in my third room before I found one that was acceptable. I won't even share my views on the neglected state of carpets, linens, etc. but dang,even the drapes were tired! The furniture looked like something in a dorm room, pretty battered and abused. The staff did their best to help me out, but I really didn't find any of the three rooms I saw to be worthy of even a neutral/average review. Maybe it would have been a lot more fun if I had visited back in my 20's or 30's. I'm not fossilized yet, but I do like clean carpets, semi-nice furniture, and drapes I'm not afraid to pull.

Reviews.Title: “Was this worth it??!!”
Reviews.Author: snowfence
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Dylan in October 2008 for one night, our last one in NYC, which was supposed to be a special treat to me and my significant other. The hotel is generally GOOD - there is absolutely no doubt about that! Some of the special features are plasma TVs, bathrobes, IPod stations, nice bathroom equpipment and additional complementary items (coffee maker, sanitary and first aid kits etc). A refurb would not hurt the hotel. All the items in our room looked very used. The bed was extremely uncomfortable but the blankets were fresh and clean, with a soft cover. Toilet was broken. Cleanliness was ok but not outstanding; so was the breakfast. Any item other than the standard will need to be covered extra (ie our cappucinos for breakfast instead of normal coffee). We paid 310USD for one night in a double room which is, for NYC standards, I guess somewhat OKish. However, I am not sure if it was really worth all the cash.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel - discover NYC by foot”
Reviews.Author: yoop7
Reviews.Content: Stylish, top location, great staff, super rooms, wlan

Reviews.Title: “So so”
Reviews.Author: NicL
Reviews.Content: Good points - central Manhattan location. Seemed clean. Staff were friendly. Not good - dark gloomy rooms (I asked to be moved which to their credit they accomodated but it wasn't much better). Dark gloomy public areas of the hotel too Didn't eat there so can't comment on the adjacent restaurant - seemed to be busy though. Won't stay there again. There will come a time in the not too distant future where we will look back laugh and say 'do you remember when there were 'boutique' hotels' - like some naff 80s fashion...sooner the better in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “No A/C, very noisy”
Reviews.Author: rsilka
Reviews.Content: The air conditioning was broken and I stayed there in the middle of recent heat wave. I would expect free water or even offer to move to another hotel in NYC but they did not really bother. Plus the place is very very noisy!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but beware of where your room is situated!!”
Reviews.Author: 19penguin67
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, we were very pleased with the location of the hotel - just around the corner from Grand Central Station and within walking distance of loads of tourist attractions. We were told that we had an upgrade to kingsize - great we thought!! Our room was on the 8th floor. It was small, dark and smelt of smoke. It was at the back of the hotel so there was also the noise of the air con. unit! The staff were very helpful and gave us a choice of 2 other rooms on the 14th floor - one at the back (again with the air con. noise and one at the front). The one we decided on was a lovely, light room at the front of the hotel. It was a queensize room but was clean, tidy, light and quiet. We would stay here again because of the location but would pre-book our room!! Staff very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Dylan”
Reviews.Author: PortugalJessie
Reviews.Content: Great location. Friendly staff. Expensive restaurant. Rooms small and dark. Would not go back. Better hotels for same money.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: sastravler
Reviews.Content: I was in NYC last week and stayed for three nights at the Dylan. I travel extensively on business and for pleasure and have stayed at many NYC hotels in the three and four star categories. So I know what to expect. I was concerned after reading some of the reviews on this site that my experience at the Dylan would be unpleasant. However, it most certainly was not. The location was excellent for my business meeting and train trip being so close to Grand Central. Moreover, the room was clean, not closet-sized and quite comfortable. While the bathroom does lack a vanity with counter space, I was able to use the glass shelves above the toilet for my toiletries without problem. I also liked the walk-in shower and found the water temperature to be consistent and the pressure very good. The staff from front desk to doormen to bellmen were universally helpful, accommodating and exceedingly polite. I was quite pleased with my stay and would return if I need to be around 41st St. again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: macfairb
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel in quieter part of town”
Reviews.Author: Surrey149
Reviews.Content: This is a great small hotel in the city. It is in a slightly quieter part about 5 minutes from 5th Avenue, which is quite a relief after a full day in the city. The rooms are spacious for a small hotel with high ceilings. I would recommend avoiding rooms at the back of the hotel where we were as there is a pretty noisy air conditioning unit. The staff are very friendly and we can strongly recommend the restaurant. The steak is exceptional and the service equally good. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Dylan”
Reviews.Author: codymae
Reviews.Content: Dylan Hotel, Midtown, NYC Date: February 17, 2008 Reviewer: Codymae The Dylan is a European style hotel with a great central location. On average I stay in hotels 12-20 times per year. I found the Dylan to be very comfortable... Great value. Friendly staff. As a single woman, I felt very safe and comfortable. Great amenities... including bathrobe & slippers. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: titteringtonrobin
Reviews.Content: Me and my partener stayed in the Dylan over the New Year 2007/8 and found the whole experience very good. The hotel is on the small size but the rooms are big for NewYork - the beds are huge!! Overall the rooms were a little tired and could do with a freshen up - but the location makes up for this - for most travellers the hotel is used a base for sightseeing and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: BerkeleyRefugee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Dylan Hotel for three nights in January. We paid $259 per night, which with tax came to $300 a night. Midtown location was very convenient, as was the super-close proximity to Grand Central Station. Service was pleasant, the room and bathroom were both spotless. Kingsize bed was great. Ipod docking station in the room. Easily adjustable thermostat kept the room cozy. The rooms look just like the photos posted. Our view was of another building, but it was far enough away that we did see daylight. Very design-y, in an almost self-consciously 'we're so cool' way. Bathroom was pretty but not very functional. We found it amusing that there was a sign asking us to save the earth by hanging up our towels. Unfortunately, there were no towel racks (just one hook). Drinking glasses in the bathroom were Pyrex beakers. Hmmm. Loved that there was a business center for guests on the third floor. While there was a charge for internet use, it was great not having to lug my laptop along on the trip. With all of the hotels to choose from, we probably would not stay here again. I'd love to try the Library Hotel across the street. If you stay here, be sure to check out the bronze "library" plaques imbedded in the sidewalk along 41st. They are very fun!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: kap22
Reviews.Content: I ended up at the Dylan for two nights at the last minute since few other hotels were available at the time. I was concerned because of several of the earlier very negative reviews. There was no reason to worry. First, this hotel is definitely not 4 Star as some seem to think it is. It is really fairly basic accomodations, but for the price in New York it was more than adequate. This is a list of what I experienced. -Good location, very convenient to public transportation -Staff was friendly -Small room but clean and comfortable -Fairly quiet for a hotel in the city (I was on the 8th floor) -Not a lot of restaurants in the immediate area, but enough As mentioned in earlier reviews, the lighting is a little dim, the heat does not seemed to be controlled in the room (although it was fine in my room), and the bathroom is interesting with the lack of shelf space. Many things like this can be expected in older facilities and I probably wouldn't have even noticed if I hadn't read some of these reviews. So if you are looking for a 4 Star experience, you should go somewhere else. If you are looking for basic, comfortable accomodations at a reasonable price (especially for NY), then the Dylan is a hotel to consider. I would have rated this as average but the reasonable price made it above average for what it cost.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: neekeebee
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at the Dylan in November and thought it was a fantastic hotel. The porters were helpful and friendly and the reception staff couldn’t have been more accommodating. Our room was big, with a big bathroom and comfy beds. The only disappointment was the scaffolding outside our window, which meant the view was spoiled, but who goes to New York to stay and look at the view from their hotel room window? The room was clean and warm and surprisingly quiet considering the location (5 mins walk to Grand Central Station). We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant, but it looked busy most nights. For breakfast you can't beat the Vegetable Garden about 4 doors to the right of the Dylan - they sold the most amazing blueberry muffins. All in all the Dylan exceeded my expectations and is a perfect base to explore the city from.

Reviews.Title: “Oh dear”
Reviews.Author: holidaygirl6
Reviews.Content: I did read the other reviews before I stayed at this hotel - but it was a bit late for me to change my booking as we were staying the Marathon Weekend. Staff - unhelpful and slow, Rooms - shabby and cold, Location - not bad, but then it is NYC so could'nt really be bad. I have stayed in NYC four times previously and in a wide range of hotels both areas and prices - this was the worst by a long shot - I am not easy to please but this was just plain awful.

Reviews.Title: “Last time at the Dylan”
Reviews.Author: BWW40
Reviews.Content: This will be my second and last stay at the Dylan. It has lost its ability to deliver the trendy luxurious experience I remember from my last visit. My room was in total disrepair between the worn carpet, worn and nicked furniture and the mold in the bathroom. I found the mini bar half full, and the service to the room slow or non-existent. I should not have to supply the concierge with all the information to a restaurant to have a simple reservation made. With so many other good hotels in New York this was a huge disappointment, and I won’t be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: broxybluenose
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Dylan for 6 nights in October. The location of the hotel is amazing, just off 5th avenue, near grand central, brilliant. However, the hotel was nothing special. It is certainly not a boutique hotel. The room was very standard, the bathroom was very small with no bath, no view outside the window, looked onto an office block, the room was very dark, with little light coming into the room, which was a nightmare for my girlfriend doing her make-up. The porter at the door was rubbish, didn't help with bags, didn't open the door (which was his job) and didn't have any of the usual new york friendliness. Don't believe any of the reviews you here about the friendly reception, they are the worst thing about the hotel, never gave eye contact, never said hello or goodbye on arrival or departure, totally useless!!!!! Other than that New York is Great!!!!! Try a hotel called 'the library' which is on the same street, looked like a proper boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: AD72
Reviews.Content: Hotel has an excellent location for the tourist sites. Grand Central is just around the corner, Times Square and the Empire State Building are all in walking distance. The hotels sells itself as a boutique hotel but in reality is just a plain ordinary hotel. Shower room is small, no bath. Our room needed a good clean, there was a fair layer of dust on the bedside tables and on the curtains which fell off when they were drawn. Staff serving breakfast were poor, got the impression they would rather not be there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: J&BKentucky
Reviews.Content: The 4 of us stayed there Oct.10-13. Although we were supposed to arrive Oct. 9, due to weather, the flight was diverted to Buffalo, NY the night of Oct. 9. When we arrived the next day, a day later than we expected, the Dylan staff put us in an upgraded room. When we found out construction was to begin outside our window, they again upgraded us to a larger suite!! We apprecitate them and the staff is wonderful. We will stay there again. (Bus from Newark aiport stops about 1 block from hotel, the Grand Central stop).

Reviews.Title: “no way is the dylan a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: LipstickVancouverBC
