Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dylan at the end of September with my daughter and found the experience rather lacking as we were given a room on the second floor ( word of warning do not except a room on the second floor) First off when we got off the elevator on our floor we were met by 3 huge skips of dirty laundry which I thought would be gone the next morning but they were still there 2 days later,the tv didn't work at all and the air con was only just working but we were tired and it was late so we just went to bed. Next morning I opened our curtains and couldn"t believe what I was looking at, a building site right outside our window, not in another building but right outside our window and the room was so dark I couldn't even put my makeup on. I went down to reception and complained that the room was a disgrace and that at nearly $400 a night it was unexceptable so they moved all our things to the 11th floor which was just a tad brighter but I still had to lean out of the window for enough light to do the makeup. The shower head fell off the wall, over all the whole experience was awful. I would never stay here again but the one good thing about the Dylan was it's location shame about the sub standard everything. It could have been a fabulous place if the upkeep had been seen to, as it was it was shabby and not worth the money, much prefer the W.

Reviews.Title: “May have been good once....”
Reviews.Author: London-Luncher
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to staying at the Dylan and after the normal stop start taxi ride from JFK wanted something special. However, on arrival I found the hotel to be covered in scaffolding and next door to a large building refurbishment. The staff were welcoming at check-in but when I enquired about a delayed check-out the welcome vanished. The room was small but with tall ceilings making you feel as though you where at the bottom of a well, this coupled with the non-stop sound of air-conditioning plant from outside did not make me feel as though I was in a four-star hotel. I suspect that, when new, the room was very trendy but several surfaces had had the paint rubbed off with ware and the room was rather dingy with lamps that did not give out sufficient light to adequately light it. The bathroom was small but normal for city hotels, however there was no place to put toiletries or even to hang towels. I managed to get a reasonable night’s sleep but only with the use of ear plugs and I was very happy to on my way the following day.

Reviews.Title: “Awfull”
Reviews.Author: GALSWITHPALS
Reviews.Content: this is not a four star hotel. staff is rude except the bell man. no heat in hotel. freezing cold and not willing to give us a space heater. they treated me horrible. and i did not sleep for 4 nights. awfull in everyway.

Reviews.Title: “Loud and Uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: travelgal30
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with our recent stay at The Dylan. The room was fine but no turndown service and few of the amenities I'd expect at a 4-star hotel. The bed was terribly uncomfortable and only 2 pillows for the bed which were squishy and horrible. What was most unbearable was the noise -- our room was on 41st Street and we could hear every single honking horn, siren and garbage truck, not to mention a line of floats parked in front of the hotel starting in the early morning, some of which tested their music at full blast at 9:00 in the morning. We realize that the hotel had little control over parade floats, but it was so loud and uncomfortable, we changed hotels as soon as we woke up in the morning. I would not recommend that anyone stay there if they want a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Dylan is a mess”
Reviews.Author: IGonz
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews on many hotels, and specially on this one, i decided to spend four nights at the Dylan. What a big mistake. We booked an Executive Room and it was small, dark, no individual air conditioning temperature control, with tired looking and chewed furniture everywhere in the room. The bed was comfortable but the blanket was stained and we missed more pillows (we had just two in the all room) Our room faced the front of the hotel, and there was a maintenance work going on, so no very nice views at all. The bathroom: SOOO TIRED ! needs an urgent updating and reparing. The towels: Not enough towels, were gray and extremely rough (dont' bring exfoliator) . The turn down servide : Is it a joke???? The service doesn't exist. Overall , the housekeeping servide was a mess!! The last day we arrive to our room at 4 pm and we has to call asking to make up our room.We wait almost 50 minutes for the housekeeper to come. A lot of problems with toiletries replacements and bathroom cleanliness. The breakfast: Needs an special chapter.... I just will say that better spend your money somewhere else, but if you want to see the worst service ever seen, with an empty buffet at 9 a.m (no spoons, plates, eggs, sausages.....) try their breakfast. Of course, we tried to cancel our reservation for the last 3 days and go to some other hotel, but is was prepaid and we couldn't do that. I would definilety not recomend this hotel to anyone. Please, consider going to any other hotel, for the same money, you can have a nice experience somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Average at Best”
Reviews.Author: ANGshire
Reviews.Content: There are a wealth of options in Manhattan, even the Library Hotel (which, incidentally is a terrific hotel) just across the street at comparable rates. Unless otherwise compelled by business, I would not stay here. It may have once been a hip, urban boutique hotel, however, it has lost its shine. The hotel is dark, dirty and tired. My room faced the back of the hotel, therefore, all evening I listened to the persistent loud hum of the ventilation system. If you must stay at the back of the hotel, insist to be on at least the 6th floor. The towels are thin and gray. The bed comfortable enough, but do not expect more than a double sheeted thin blanket. The closet barely holds the 2 robes the hotel provides. All the furniture corners are chewed. Staff is nice enough, however, management should start thinking about spending some real money on a soft renovation. I have lived in Manhattan for a number of years, and return often for business . . . keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Dylan”
Reviews.Author: DCtraveler427
Reviews.Content: After reading the other reviews, I was looking forward to staying at the Dylan and had booked two separate stays there. However, my family and I were very disappointed. The staff was welcoming at check-in and nice in general. The room was an adequate size with tall ceilings. We had a "double double" and one bed was collapsed in the middle. The room was generally rather run down, dingy and dreary, with low wattage light bulbs in too few lamps. The bathroom was very small, with no place to put toiletries or even to hang towels once they were used. The cold water faucet at the sink turned the wrong way so when we would turn it to shut off the water, water would gush out. Given the shape of the sink, the water sprayed all over (on us and on the floor) until we got used to turning it the wrong way to shut it off. The room generally was not comfortable and we were glad to leave. I would not consider this to be a 4 star hotel by any stretch of the imagination. Needless to say, I cancelled our second reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Nirvana in New York City!”
Reviews.Author: dtour_7
Reviews.Content: After a terrible experience at another hotel close by, we chose the Dylan for its good reviews and affordability. It ended up being the best part of our trip! The modern theme of this boutique hotel does not take away from its comfort with a great layout, space and furniture. Because it was so affordable for NYC, we opted for the executive suite and had plenty of room for two travellers with a lot of luggage. There was even a cozy sofa with pullout as part of the full living room set up. The decor was amazing, a cute, mod layout with cooling blues and greens made for a luxuriously calming retreat after a day of running around the city -- we were actually excited to return early to our room! The staff downstairs was SO friendly and accomadating! When we told them our horror story down the street, they let us check in hours early and offered to send up special amenities to help us "relax". They were also available to offer great suggestions for dining during our stay. Good location, and easy walk to Times Square and just a skip to Grand Central, although most businesses in the immediate area were closed for the weekend as it seems to be in a business district. Overall, great great space to come back to after a busy day in the city. It may not be the cheapest hotel in the city, but definately the best value!! We didn't want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: houstonpsp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dylan for two nights at $289 per night via hotelconnextions.com. It was terrific at that price and hard to come by in NYC these days. The room was small but very clean as was the bathroom. The best part was the quiet. Many hotels can't insulate out the street noise. We didn't hear a thing...in the hall or street. It is a small place so there aren't groups of tourists and all that goes with large chain hotels. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Plesant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Globbie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to NYC for a wedding in September and all the hotels were really expensive since it was the high season. Luckily we found a relatively good deal online for the Dylan hotel, and since it was near the wedding venue, we decided to try it out. The hotel is quite small and close to the Grand Central station, but it is easy to walk pass it without realising it because the entrance is quite discreet. We did not spend a lot of time at the hotel because we were out with friends most of time, but in general, we found the service very friendly and efficent esp. the porters/ doormen. The room was decent for NY standard, everything was modern and quite minimalist. The bathroom was a bit disappointing because there was no bath tub and not much room to put our toiletries. We did not eat in the hotel, but I have been to the bar previously and thought the cocktails and snacks were good. On the whole, we enjoyed our stay at the hotel and we would considering returning someday soon!

Reviews.Title: “mixed reviews”
Reviews.Author: rouleaj
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Dylan for 3 nigths on a girl getaway. It's in a great location and the staff is very pleasant. But I'm glad we booked through Venere.com and only paid 259$/night. The rack rate was above 500$. The room was a bit worn out, in need of painting and a fresh carpet, but very clean. I'm only saying, try to get it on a discount web site instead of paying full price.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Dylan - let Liza sort it all out”
Reviews.Author: Lizarocks
Reviews.Content: The Dylan is a well-located, cool hotel w/ beautiful lighting throughout and several other nice features, but the standout reason to recommend it is Liza at the front desk who really makes you feel like you're her personal guest. She's really efficient but also really relaxed and just fun combined with excellent commonsense and fabulous memory. Good thing she seems to be there 24 / 7, the place just wouldn't be the same without. her

Reviews.Title: “My Favourite Place Ever”
Reviews.Author: mattyIreland
Reviews.Content: My Partner and I stayed at the Dylan Hotel and decided to try out the Restaurant before we went to the Bryan Adam's Concert in January 2007. To our surprise we had the best meal ever in our lives, that is if you like Steak that is. We liked it so much we invited my Sister and Her Partner to join us for a meal on the Sunday before we left. They had taken us to Les Halles on the Saturday night and had gone by themselves to Per Se on the Friday Night. They were just blown away by the quality and ambiance of the Restaurant. The Manager Victor and His Staff were amazing, really attentive and friendly. Not what you would expect for a Restaurant in Mid Town New York.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up.”
Reviews.Author: jetsdead
Reviews.Content: I met my wife here, who was here on business/pleasure, on a Saturday after she had been here 2 nights already. I stayed only one night. The staff was great. They were courteous, helpful and accommodating. The room was as expected for Manhattan, small. The décor was stylishly modern with really high ceilings. The bathroom was also pretty small with little counter space. We had an interior facing room so not a lot of noise to worry about but at the same time not a lot of natural light. The hotel’s location was perfect for us. Grand Central Station was only 2 blocks away which gave us easy access to the subway. It is also only about 4 blocks from Times Square and about 8 blocks from Rockefeller Center. There was also some shooting for a new Will Smith flick taking place practically outside the lobby. That was fun. The wireless worked ok on the fourth floor which allowed this geek to keep in touch. We never visited the in-house restaurant or bar so we can’t comment on it but they looked quite nice. Overall, our stay was very nice. The limited space aside, we were happy with our experience.

Reviews.Title: “what a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: angelbreeze
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the dylan for 3 nights march 2nd -5th. i was really impressed,the staff were all really helpful and polite. the room was spotless,lovely clean battroom. i have no faults with it whatsoever

Reviews.Title: “The best!”
Reviews.Author: spendyscot
Reviews.Content: Hi The Dylan is a wonderful place to stay to explore New York. The staff are extremely friendly, efficient and helpful. The rooms are clean, comfortable and large. The position of the Dylan is great - especially for a first time visitor - access to the subway via Grand Central means you can get anywhere very easily. The room service is great when your feet hurt so much you couldn't move any more ;-) I highly recommend the Dylan and will definitely stay there the next time I go to New York. It made the whole stay pleasurable beginning to end. cheers Spendyscot

Reviews.Title: “it's ok”
Reviews.Author: Texastravelinggal
Reviews.Content: The room are small. compare to Texas hotel,but normal for New York. The hotel staff are super nice and friendly! the location is good. You're only a block away from grand central station. the hotel was really close to the subway. There is a deil called Charlie that open 24hrs and have some good late night food. PROBLEM: the sink is really small! when you turn on the water, the water will splash to the floor. You will you hit your head on the mirrow when you split into the sink( that how small they are). My friends had a room on the 7th floor and their sink was a bowl shape which was a little bigger but still tiny. the water pressure to take a shower was low. There were no counter space which made it hard to get ready for a girl. I might stay here again if I came to new york by myself.

Reviews.Title: “exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: beccabear
Reviews.Content: The Dylan was such a wonderful experience for a first time NYC traveler. After overpacking I was very pleased to find that Grand Central was litterly a 1-2 minute walk from the hotel. When we checked in to our room it was very nice, but way to hot... THe room was litterly 95 degrees. I called down to the front desk and they happily gave us a different room. The first impression of the rooms there are CLEAN!! all the bedding is white and the bathroom shines!! The staff was kind and very helpful. They got us cabs if we needed it, made dinner reservations for us and gave us tips about the city. We ate dinner one night at the resturant in the hotel, we ordered the steak for two and it was hands down the best steak we both have ever had!! One of our friends lives in the city and came up to our room, she had never heard of our hotel and was very surpirsed to find the room very large at a reasonable price. I would highly recommened this hotel and I will personally be staying here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Skip it...”
Reviews.Author: swiss_darwin
Reviews.Content: Generally friendly staff doesn't make up for the total lack of daylight and bathrooms the size of closets...

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location & great value”
Reviews.Author: MikeCratchley
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at The Dylan. Arrived late on pre-Thanksgiving day and front desk staff could not have been more helpful in checking us in and organising food. Room was very comfortable but overlooking offices and bed was sublime! Location was great - so close to everything that we could walk to most places and because 41st is not a cross-town route, it was incredibly quiet yet we had no probs getting cabs. Congratulations to all the staff - you should all be very proud of the tight ship that you run!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location, rooms and freindly staff !!!”
Reviews.Author: Traveller_VC
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Dylan for 5 nights and had a fantastic stay. We had a basic room with a king size bed, and it felt really spacious and not at all small like other New York hotel rooms can be. As the ceilings are really high, the room felt a lot bigger then it really was. Bathroom was fine and clean, and perfect for what we needed. Staff were really friendly, helpful and attentive to our requirements. Our flight wasn't till late so we were given a late checkout plus they stored the luggage. Location of the hotel is perfect. Can walk to everywhere and Grand Central is just 1 block away. I can't think of any faults with the hotel. We didn't really open the curtains of the room, as there was an office block facing our windows and you could see people through the windows. This really didn't cause us any issues, as we had the curtains drawn mostly when we were in the room. I preferred to do that rather then have a noisy room overlooking the main road. Oh and the wireless internet access did work in our room. In summary, great stay and would recommend the hotel to others !!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and charming - I'll definitely return”
Reviews.Author: rms519
Reviews.Content: The Dylan Hotel is perfect for a business traveler -- great location (near Grand Central Station) but on a quiet street so you don't hear the city that never sleeps while you're trying to sleep. (In fact, even straining my ears I couldn't hear a sound all night, inside or outside the hotel.) I thought the "chemistry" touches were charming -- a petri dish for the soap dish, beakers for drinking glasses (which turned out to be very useful for filling the iron with water!). The bed was very comfortable, and there was no sign of any dreaded polyester bedspreads (a deal-breaker for me at a hotel). All the bedcoverings were washable. As with the linens, the whole place was clean and modern. The wireless internet doesn't really work, but a call to the front desk had a nice man with an ethernet cable at my door within three minutes. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ababychicken
Reviews.Content: The Dylan is a very comfortable, clean hotel just one block from Grand Central Station, making transit around Manhattan so easy! The check-in was a little tricky, since they couldn't find our reservation for 10 minutes..... The room had high ceilings so it felt much larger than it really was. Very quiet and clean. The bathroom is all marble. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Dylan!”
Reviews.Author: MiamiNY
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dylan the weekend of Oct. 5th and had a fabulous time! The hotel is small, but it is extremely inviting and the staff is superb. The bellboys were sweet and accomodating. The frontdesk was informative and answered all of our questions, they didn't even flinch when we arrived very late one evening and had lost our key. They simply smiled and handed us a brand new set. Our room was just the right size and the beds were so comfortable it was hard to get up in the mornings. The bathrooms were very clean and brightly lit. Room service was excellent, especially the Lobster Bisque. The hotel is in a great location just across from Grand Central and close to 5th Avenue shopping. We will definitely stay here again, and we're telling all our friends to do the same!

Reviews.Title: “OK but very cold”
Reviews.Author: Christine166
Reviews.Content: The Dylan is in a nice area and is very close to most to the attractions. Check in was very quick and easy. The room was large and clean but very cold. Breakfast was OK, not large amounts to choose from but enough. I would recommend staying here as it is a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bed at The Dylan!”
Reviews.Author: hotelgirl111
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Dylan after staying the preceeding nights at The Library Hotel which is literally a few doors down 41st Street. I agree that the block is great in terms of being quiet. No noise complaints at either hotel, though I definitely preferred the Library. That said, the Dylan had the better bed! Our room (901) had a nice big layout with a king bed that was really comfy. The bathroom is huge and really neat looking. Everything is very modern stylistically. If space is your chief concern in a NY hotel, the Dylan gave us plenty of room for two to share a space. Service was great! We asked for non-down pillows and they were delivered quickly. When we check in, our first room smelled like cigarette smoke and we were immediately moved to a better smelling room. When the wireless internet signal was weak, we were given an ethernet cable to attach to the wall outlet. Downsides: -I couldn't for the life of me figure out how to open a window in our room -The curtains made the room very dark, but if you opened them then you let the people across the street look into the room. -The elevators took a while and seemed old and rickety

Reviews.Title: “Liked it very, very much”
Reviews.Author: Aguardiente
Reviews.Content: Great service, great (but pricey) restaurant, very clean rooms, etc. But this is what counts: despite it being in the heart of the city, I was SO surprised at how quiet it is. You don't hear the honking cabbies, ambulances, people yelling on the street, etc. This was great but the bad part is the reason behind it. All rooms are facing either a brick wall or another building which is all offices and so close, they can help you pick out an outfit. It's bad enough to not have a view but the need to keep your curtains drawn all day (unless you are into people seeing you naked) is depressing. Nonetheless, I am very happy with The Dylan and certainly plan on returning.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Dylan”
Reviews.Author: bunny4834
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Dylan for 4 nights in NYC. The staff members were all very nice and helpful. I had an executive room and it was very nice. The bathroom was WONDERFUL very large and all marble with jet tub and seperate all glass shower with great pressure. They provide hair dryer, shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, lotion, shower caps and shoe shine cloth. Every night they had a chocolate on the bed in a little bag. The bed was very comfortable and feather pillows, nice sheets and the room was VERY clean and smelled nice. They have wine and glasses in the room for sale along with a mini bar. The only thing that could improve would be air conditioning in the halls and elevator, it was over 100 during the stay and they were having air conditioning issues, the room was comfortable, but not as cool as I like it. They were in the process of repairs and on the last day it was cold in my room. In all fairness the temp was so high I'm sure it would be hard to keep any place cool. It was a great location very short walk to Grand Central. Anything I called and asked for they delivered within 10 minutes. In all, the Dylan is a 4 star in my book and will be my first choice when I visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Dylan is the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: trvllr1
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Dylan at 7am and the staff were extreemely accomodating in checking us into our room early. The king room we got on the 9th floor is just as the website photos... beutiful decor, bathroom and overall feel. AC was powerful and cool. View was of an office block, but hey who sits in their rooms looking out windows? Very hot in hallways and elevators..but we were there during the heatwave. We found all of the staff to be a great help. Our TV was playing up a little, but fixed promptly. The location is amazing. 1 minutes walk to Grand Central station and the subway. Buses are 20 metres away. Wireless connection was absolutely fine in our room. Didnt eat in the hotels restaurant as so many options near by. Times sq is only a couple of blocks away. Turn down service and papers in the morning are nice touches. We will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “2 thumbs up for Dylan”
Reviews.Author: Luvtotravel7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in early June 2006 & really enjoyed the room. Much more spacious & clean over other hotels we've stayed at in NYC. We booked over the Internet & paid for a king but they initially installed us in a room with a Queen. It took 2 phone calls to Reception plus a visit and a wait of over an hour to get moved. This was the only glitch in an otherwise very nice stay. The staff were very nice & the bellboys did a fantastic job getting us a taxi when it was pouring rain in Friday rush hour. The beds & linens are excellent and the dark curtains made for a long slepp; the bathrobes & slippers are a nice touch. Only 2 complaints about were the bathroom is short of counter/storage space for toiletries and the constant hum of HVCA systems is rather noisy, but it's constant so we still managed to sleep through it. We generally found it very quiet there & since we live in the countryside & not in a city, we are used to extreme quiet so we slept well. It's very close to Grand Central Stn which is great. There aren't many good class restaurants in the area so you have to travel to find somewhere to eat for dinner. We found a great food market in Grand Central plus a wine store there. We did eat at their restaurant one evening & had a reasonably decent, altho expensive, meal. I would certainly return to this hotel & would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: swissbug
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for 1 week for business. i had also read the somewhat dubious reviews and so was a little wary of staying there. firstly it is a boutique hotel so it is smaller and less "grand" than the big chains. but thats ok if you aren't spending the whole day in. the staff on sunday were a little sparse but ok. during the weekdays they were more lively and helpful never needed to eat in, as just right outside to the left and right there is starbucks and several bagel/coffee places. i loved that is was right behind grand central station. (there is a good food court in the basement of it, plus you should try the oyster bar restaurant too) the room i had was ok. the bed was huge (queensize) the bathroom had only shower fascilties, but in the summer who wants to take a bath anyway? the view we had was facing the office block opposite, so not too interesting one thing though, the bathroom floor is marble so very slippery. use the bath mat provided to help with that. the tv was sometimes a little fuzzy but you can adjust the antennae on the top. they provide usa today for free each morning, but i opted for the NY times option but they never brought it. there is an iron and ironing board in the room. also the lift is really really slow.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good staff, okay rooms”
Reviews.Author: embarcadero
Reviews.Content: I stayed here becuase I had been a guest at this hotel back in 2000 and really liked it. The lobby was the same, and the staff were reasonbly nice (though not always good at their jobs). That was it. The room I had this time was tiny - it was called an 'executive king" and it made me fearful of what the normal rooms were like. I later learned that they had in fact sold out of the room type I had booked and given me a smaller one instead - when I complained, they put me in a room of similiar size with a jacuzzi. This practice is really irritating - I would have appreciated the room I booked or a discount for taking something smaller. The staff were at least up front in explaining the problem. Since the hotel was full, this was in fact a way of raising their rates. I'm sure they charged the guy in my room more than I was paying. The rooms, though tiny, were okay, but it took two calls to engineering to get things working. The television was not connected to the wall and the high speed internet was not working. The hotel claims it has wireless and may in fact have it on some floors, but not on the 16th floor or in the restaurant. The engineer explained to me that this was because the building was old and the signals don't go through the walls. I didn't laugh at him, but my computer was receiving signals from two other wireless networks from offices nearby. He must be new to his job. Housekeeping was okay, but they had the most annoying desire to restock the minibar at 10 am on weekends, even with the "do not disturb" sign. Maybe they're new to hotels, but I'm not sure 10 AM is a good time to restock minibars. The drinks downstairs are okay, the food is only mediocre though. No big deal since you can walk or take the subway to eat anywhere in Manhattan very easily. I didn't encounter any surly staff - they were all pretty uniformly nice and attempted to be helpful. One front desk staff didn't quite know how to book a car service to go to Kennedy - he said that a taxi was the only way other than the bus. He must be new to his job too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the middle of it all”
Reviews.Author: finally1122
Reviews.Content: I think it's worth noting that this was not the hotel that we originally booked. We were assigned the Paramount Hotel by Priceline for $105/night but at check in at the Paramount we were told that the hotel was undergoing renovations and that the Dylan Hotel would be accommodating us instead. I was impressed by the gesture of the Paramount paying for our cab fare to get to Dylan, about 7 blocks away. The Dylan hotel is a small boutique hotel with about 100 rooms located off of Madison Avenue. The location was convenient to Grand Central Terminal and the subway, less than 1 block away. I enjoy staying at these smaller boutique hotels because the staff seems more capable to help and the building is more unique than a large convention hotel. We go to New York a lot and are glad we were away from the touristy Time Square, without it being to far of a walk. Service was quite helpful and pleasant, contrary to what others say here. The room was large by NYC standards, high ceilings and a large, comfortable bad. There were several magazines provided in the room to help you plan out your day of what to see and do in the city. The bathroom was small but had a shower (no bathtub) and vanity. We did not use the restaurant but it looked quite nice, a destination for people to come to eat at, not just a place where hotel guests frequent. There was also a well stocked honor bar in the room with snacks and drinks in the room. The fitness center was small and we did not use it. Overall we were very pleased with this hotel, and an otherwise bad situation of getting our hotel changed turned out positively.

Reviews.Title: “Staff could Care Less”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Dylan Hotel although equipped with nice hotel rooms, could care less whether you had a good stay. They do not greet with smiles, nor do they offer you a guide to the surrounding city. Our rooms were not ready when we arrived and our luggage was checked. This meant it was set out in the open in the lobby foyer. Overall, the rooms are nice, but the staff is lacking in hotel hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, awful staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm going to echo the sentiments of several others. The hotel itself was fine - comfortable rooms, roomy bathroom, great location. I thought the front desk staff was aloof and unhelpful. (The door man -- a cute little guy with a shaved head -- was great, though.) It seemed like the hotel operations weren't organized particularly well, either. We were scheduled to have 8 people staying in two rooms, so double beds were an obvious "must have." When we checked in at noon, we were told that there were no double rooms available even though we had booked our trip several months in advance. So each room had four people and one bed - not so comfortable considering how much we were paying to stay there. In addition, we weren't able to check into our first room until 5:00, and we weren't given our second room until 6:30 -- a problem since our dinner reservation was at 7:00. Imagine 8 girls trying to crowd around one mirror to get ready for a night out. When we complained about having to wait, the staff was pretty ambivalent. In the end, we did get a discount on the rooms, but the experience left me with a bad taste in my mouth. Based on my experience, you can get much better service from other hotels in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: Julesy09
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Dylan this past weekend. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the room was a good size (for NY) and was on a high enough floor that we couldn't hear the construction noises from the street below. The temperature control in the room didn't work the first night (it was a bit chilly) but was fixed within 10 minutes of asking about it. GREAT location. Will be staying here again in May and I'm really looking forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, no surprises”
Reviews.Author: raejgar
Reviews.Content: Always looking for a reasonable deal in Manhattan. Got a good rate, though not a busy time. Great mid-town location, close to GCentral. Pretty good size room with comfortable beds. Nothing very luxurious, but clean and well kept. Small, quiet and good value for the money $209.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had had some real panic after reading the reviews. The staff was wonderful. They were always there to help call a cab or a car for us , asking if we needed anything. The rooms was just what we thought it would be. My husband and I were there for our anniversary and the dinning staff was wonderful to us. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Dylan average, didn't wow me”
Reviews.Author: tfspanier
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dylan from fri-mon, and paid $205/nt on their website. I have stayed in several hotels in Manhattan, for business & pleasure, and thought the Dylan was average. If you get a good rate here, it might be worth it. But don't expect comfy duvets or a special stay. (See pics.) We stayed in a standard room, which was the usual small size for NYC. Our 11th floor room had a window, but not a view. There were three adults in our room, which seemed snug. With no overhead lighting, only bedside lamps, the room was poorly lit. The bathroom was slightly odd. There was no place to set your personal toiletries (see pics), and it was nearly impossible to wash your face in the sink. There are no towel rails, and only one hook. The shower also had poor water pressure, and once even stopped working in the middle of my shower. (It returned quickly after.) The free internet was a bonus. The wireless was intermittent. I was told that the old building was interferring with the signal. (?) Front desk brought me an ethernet cable. The Chemistry Club was usually quiet. (Don't expect The Royalton.) Even on Super Bowl Sunday, and at the start of NY Fashion Week (which all happens on the Dylan's doorstep at Bryant Park), the bar was empty. The hotel staff were fairly average as well. Front desk ordered a cab for us to JFK, which never came. We ended up hailing a cab, and were fine. Many of the average reviews here are spot on. All is true about the good location, but otherwise I wasn't blown away. Though the hotel served its purpose, and nothing was actively bad, I will stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Eye contact goes a long way.....”
Reviews.Author: Melto
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a great weekend in New York! Stayed at the Dylan for 3 nights and have mixed feelings about this hotel. To start, considering the insane rates for a decent midtown hotel this past weekend, we got a fair rate. So with regards to the price tag, we were happy. Having read prior reviews, I was prepared for this hotel to not be "service oriented", nor friendly. Well your reviews were dead on. Upon checking in, the "clerk" did not even lift his eyes from whatever he was doing, as he greeted us with "Can I help you?" I thought he was talking to his computer. It was a complete joke. It is as if this hotel goes out of its way to train their staff to be unfriendly! However, Chad was nice. The next night, when my friend called down to ask the conceirge a question, he barked at her, telling her he is too swamped to answer her right now (funny, considering, I never saw another sole in the hotel during our 3 day stay!) It just seems that a hotel should pride itself on customer sevice, hospitality and friendliness, and this hotel certainly does not. Apart from the staff though, our room was decent, bed comfortable(but not the pillows), room was quiet,only 2 elevators, but we never had to wait for one, and the location was great. Yet, with the hundreds of hotels to chose from in Manhattan, I will try some place else upon my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Content: First the good news, good location & very competitve price for Oct/Nov . However the web page & the reality of the rooms are miles apart, they were dark, no view, dull furnishings & worn for a relatively new 'designer boutique' hotel. The reception area was dark/dull & staff did not seem particularly helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Staffed by the Surlys”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms are New York small, and noisy on the street side. But they are clean and pleasant enough. Trying very hard to be hip. The problem with the Dylan is that staff couldn't care less what happens to you. For example, the internet connection is free, but there is nothing in the room to tell you about it (it has both ethernet and wi-fi connections, but you only know that by trial and error). Tried to leave a wake up call with the automated system, it didn't work. Tried the operator at 11:00PM, no answer. Left the wake up call with the front desk. In the morning, no wake up call, no receipt upon checkout and no help getting a taxi on narrow 41st Street. For the same money, you can get an entry level room at the Waldorf and will be much happier.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite the boutique experience”
Reviews.Author: CT94010
Reviews.Content: I was fairly disappointed with this hotel. I travel frequently to NY and have stayed in all different type of hotels from boutique to large chain in the city and I haven't been this disappointed in a hotel in quite a long time. First the positive: 1. Location. It is steps away from Grand Central, and better yet, to the express bus stops to all three NYC airports, with buses that run every 30 minutes from 4 am to 1 am or so. No need for an expensive cab or subway to train transfers. I used the bus ($13) to make a Newark airport flight - left at 3:15 and arrived at 4:20. 2. Size of Room. I booked an executive King and got a rate of $349. Being mid-October, this was about one of the best rates I could get for an upgraded room at a decent hotel. It was on the 15th floor and was definitely commodious. There was no view, but I was high enough to get some view of the sky. The windows opened, which was a plus. 3. Internet. Complementary laptop access through ethernet. There was a wireless network, but I could not get a network address assigned -- I have a brand spanking new PC and never have any problems elsewhere, so I suspect there is something wrong with the wireless network. I didn't bother calling down, since I was fine with the ethernet cable. Now the partly negative. 1. Staff. I had read the recent reviews about the staff and I usually read these with some level of cynicism, as I have witnessed my share of rude and unreasonable customer scenes. But I think there may be some truth to the criticisms I have read here. My experience checking in was fairly negative. The front desk person was not rude, but he certainly was not friendly or welcoming. I guess I don't expect the staff to be subservient or ingratiating, but a "Good Morning, Welcome to the Dylan Hotel!" and a smile might have been nice. I received neither. When I went up to the desk and told them I was checking in, all I got was a cold, sighing, "What is your name?" "I'll need your VISA card." The desk person just seemed bored and aloof, and not particularly happy about his job. Bad way to start the stay. I should say that it was only the front desk person on that Saturday morning that behaved that way. The other times I had dealings at the front desk, it was decent. The bellhops, doormen and maids were wonderful, however. 2. Common Areas. Having stayed at the Hudson and even the smaller hotel in the same group as the Dylan, the Time, I was disappointed with the common areas. The lobby area is small and nicely furnished, but the waiting area directly accross the reception desk is small, basically a couple couches. There's no lounge area or bar or library or places to hang out that you would normally find in a boutique hotel. In fact the Dylan had far less amenities in that way than even a high-quality chain hotel. Basically, the Dylan reminded me more of a dormitory than a boutique hotel. The photos on the websites really make the hotel look far more "hip" and modern than it really is. 3. Room. Wasnt as nicely furnished as it appeared in the photos. The room I had was on the interior light well. Though the windows opened to let fresh air in, there was a huge ventilation fan going the whole time. Furnishings okay, big King bed was comfortable. 4. Heating/AirConditioning. I was there in mid October. The weather was in the mid 70s. I arrived to a room that had the heat going. I tried to get the air conditioner to work, but was told by the desk that their HVAC could only do heat or aircon, and that they had already converted it to heat for the season. Therefore, the only thing to do was to turn off the unit. I had to open the windows and prop open the door to cool off the room. It wasn't so bad, but I feel sorry for the person who is there during an unseasonal cold snap or heat wave! *** Overall, I would say that if you can get a cheap rate for this place, its probably a good value. It was not worth the $350 what I paid. If location is key and you want the small hotel experience , the Library Hotel is up the street from the Dylan. I have stayed at the Library before, and it has smaller rooms, but being on the corner, better chance for views, as well as a great lounge areas and a well-trained service-oriented staff. Or if you don't care about boutique and don't mind big, the Grand Hyatt at Grand Central, which is right next to (on top of?) the terminal is a fine high-quality choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Boutique Hotel near Everything”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Dylan is a little modern gem near Grand Central, only steps away from the Empire State, a few blocks from Times Square and everyhting that New York has to offer. I was there for 3 nights last week. Great staff with lots of advise on everything, rooms with more than average size, nice beds and bathrooms. Only complaint was that pillows were very hard and shower curtain would drift inside the shower when water was on. Great shower heads and products. Overall very comfy with OK design. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A real find”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was comfortable and well designed. Restaurant was elegant and expensive - especially for breakfast. Terrific location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Dylan Hotel - Friendly Staff and a great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from staying five days at The Dylan Hotel. The hotel is magnificent and we found the staff excellent from the concierge to the Reception Staff and Room Service Staff. We really enjoyed ourselves at the Hotel and would highly recommend The Dylan. The hotel is in a great location and was not far from the Shopping, eating, entertainment areas with the subway not far away. When we were in New York it was very hot with over 85% humidity, we really enjoyed the peace and tranquility of the hotel when we returned. Chek out The Dylan next time you want a place to stay, choose and exective room and you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay - Large Rooms”
Reviews.Author: tostina
Reviews.Content: The Dylan was a very nice hotel, the rooms were very large, very comfortable, great linens. The toiletries weren't as good as they could have been, but were acceptable. The staff was very helpful and friendly. We did not try the new restaurant, but the menu looked good. It's a short walk to Bryant Park and Times Square but without being too busy. We paid $188 a night, which was a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The desk staff was not helpful, it appeared there were some employees that were very unhappy working there, given their rather snotty attitude - many didn't know simple directions, wouldn't offer assistance in procuring silverware, etc. The room was - ok. I liked the furnishings, loved the bathroom, the bed was quite comfortable. I was disappointed that the room had basic cable only - I was very tired after 3 days of eight hour interviews and just needed to relax! Location was convenient - a block away from Grand Central. I completed an internet survey with my complaints about service & never heard a word back. This certainly doesn't make me want to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “No restaurant and no bar and a boring location”
Reviews.Author: thetravelgoddess
Reviews.Content: This hotel would love to be hip but its not. Location great if you want to be near Grand Central and the New York Public Library. Not near any interesting night life at all in New York and located on a pretty inocuous cross street a bit too far east. Not much interesting going on in this neighborhood in the way of restaurants, nightlife or shopping. Theatre district is not too far away and can be reached within a 15 minute walk. Hotel restaurant and bar were closed and have been for ages (make that years). They keep saying a restaurant will be opening soon but don't believe them until it does as they've been saying this ever since Brittany Spears restaurant Nayla was shut down shortly after it opened. The standard rooms are really small and only have small showers and no tub. Strongly recommend you book the executive rooms that are like junior suites and have great high tech equipment. For the price, there are far better and more interesting options available in NYC that are closer to nightlife, shopping and local sites. Staff appears to be confused and unable to resolve minor problems. Lastly, Alchemy suite is the only one like it in the hotel and it looks far more impressive in the photos than in person. If you are looking for a romantic getaway and still feel compelled to stay here that would be my first choice as at least it has a funky charm to it rather than the not particularly interesting minimalism reflected in the rest of the rooms. The only time this hotel is ever booked up is when NYC is completely sold out or during fashion week due to its proximity to Bryant Park. Doing a bit of research I find there are many better options for a quick getaway in NYC. How much fun can it be to stay in a hotel with no restaurant and no bar. Concierge services...someone ought to tell the hotel exactly what this means and at least have one with some contacts who actually knows the best, the most fun and the hot restaurants in tow so they not only can recommend then abd the best clubs has a few contacts to actually get you in. All in all, this is just not a very interesting or amusing place to stay. No life to this place...it is simply dullsville.

Reviews.Title: “Check your Bank Account After!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I didn't really have any problems with the hotel during my stay. However, when I returned, despite having paid the bill through Expedia, the hotel charged an additional 664 dollars to my credit card instead of 8 dollars for phone calls.

HotelInfo.Name: Dylan Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 52 East 41st Street, New York City, NY 10017
